Talk_26:
<sp:3:0:2:0800>I've activated a <clr:0000>travel gate<clr:ffff> outside this
lab. Now you can get here instantly,
if not faster!
<clr:0000><sp:3:0:2:0000><clr:ffff>You'll need to make your own way to the
Akkala Ancient Tech Lab, however.

You'll find the <clr:0000>travel medallion prototype<clr:ffff>
in a chest beside my desk there. Should
be easy enough to find.

<sp:3:0:2:0701><snd:QuestionNormal_00>I'd go get it myself, but word is that

your great talents, go there and fetch

Talk_10:
<sp:3:0:2:0800><clr:0000>Hero's path mode<clr:ffff> is an outstanding
addition if you do a lot of investigating!

Truth is, there's a tracking feature
installed on the Purah Pad. Hero's path
mode lets you see this feature on-screen!
It's a brilliant system that lets you see
the exact path you've taken!

<sp:3:0:2:0700>But before I can install the prototype
perfectly, I'll need to get <clr:0000>data from
15 shrine locations<clr:ffff> from you.

Talk_11:
<sp:3:0:2:0c00>Of course you want the <clr:0000>travel medallion<clr:ffff>
feature. Who wouldn't want to travel
instantly to wherever you want!
I will need my <clr:0000>travel medallion prototype<clr:ffff>,
which is at the Akkala Ancient Tech Lab.
Sorry, but—<sp:5:1:0> Hmm?<sp:5:1:0>
<sp:3:0:2:0400><snd:QuestionNormal_01>Wait! Do I detect the unmistakable odor

Talk_12:

Talk_13:

That should be a walk in the park for

Talk_54:
<sp:3:0:2:0800>Excellent! Very good thinking, being
curious about this feature!

It allows you to pinpoint the location of
more than shrines—many more things.
That's why it's called <clr:0000>sensor +<clr:ffff>!
<sp:3:0:2:0c00>You select what you want from the
compendium. But I can't add my
prototype without some extra data...
So you need to fill out your <clr:0000>compendium
with at least five types of monsters<clr:ffff>.
Talk_55:

for a moment.
Talk_57:

to find from the Hyrule Compendium!
Talk_80:

<sp:3:0:2:0c01>I wonder what I could do if I had even

need about <clr:0000>10 map-data locations<clr:ffff>...<sp:5:0:0>
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:LaughS_00>Which should be a walk in the park
for someone like you!
Pos_0100:
"Sensor Instructions"


When moving toward a Shrine of Light
you haven't visited before, you'll hear a
sound that will alert you to its location.
The sound will be more frequent when
you're moving more directly toward
the shrine.
But the sound only goes off when you're
actually moving. So don't stop if you
want to keep following its lead.
If you want to stop the sensor from
finding shrines, push <sp:1:4:2:0dcd> on the
map screen.
Talk_43:
<sp:3:0:2:0c01>Given the maximum capacity, I could add
the ability to create <clr:0000>one<clr:ffff> more of those.

I can create a link between the pad and
a third location, but for that I'd need
about <clr:0000>15 map-data locations<clr:ffff>...<sp:5:1:0>
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:LaughS_00>That's a walk in the park for someone
like you!
Talk_44:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>Well...<sp:5:0:0>I've told you what you need to
know about that <clr:0000>sensor<clr:ffff>. But I fear it's
gone in one ear and out the other.
So, hang on a minute.
Pos_0200:
"Sensor + Instructions"


You can detect things found in your
Hyrule Compendium in the same way that
you can detect shrines.
First, select what you what to detect
by pressing <sp:1:4:2:0dcd> on the map screen.

Then you will hear a sound alerting you
to your target as you get nearer to it.

To change the target back to shrines,
press <sp:1:4:2:0dcd> on the map screen.
Talk_45:
<sp:3:0:2:0c01><snd:QuestionNormal_00>OK, the details look correct... And I'll
post it right here...

<sp:3:0:2:0100>Yes! Very good!
Talk_46:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>Here you go! The <clr:0000>operation instructions<clr:ffff>
for the <clr:0000>travel medallion<clr:ffff> feature!
Pos_0300:
Hero's Path Mode Instructions


Press <sp:1:4:2:28cd> on the map screen to switch
Hero's Path Mode on and off.

It's a great feature that displays the path
you've traveled during your journey
on the map.
It will record up to 256 hours of path,
but as you exceed that, the oldest
parts of your path will be deleted.
You can also study your path to see
where you haven't yet gone. Those
places may have things left to discover!
Talk_06:
<sp:3:0:2:0c01>But first I'll need you to gather some test
data so I can fine-tune my prototypes.

<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Happy_01>So! Let's get to work on that pad!


Just talk to me anytime you'd like to get
started on any of these.
Talk_47:
<sp:0:2:2:7d00><sp:3:0:2:0800><snd:Happy_00>Completed!<sp:0:2:2:6400><sp:0:4:0>At last, your Purah Pad is perfect!<sp:5:0:0>
And that means...

<sp:0:2:2:7d00><sp:3:0:2:0800><snd:Happy_01>You are perfect!<sp:0:2:2:6400><sp:0:4:0>That is the objective truth, I'm very
pleased to say.

<sp:3:0:2:0701>Because with ALL of that, you'll make
infinitely better progress in your search
for Princess Zelda.
Now, when you find Princess Zelda...<sp:5:1:0>


<sp:3:0:2:0800><snd:LaughL_01>be sure to tell her you couldn't have
done it without my Purah Pad
improvements!

Pos_0400:
Travel Medallion Instructions


The travel medallion feature lets you
create a travel gate at any spot you'd
like to return to instantly.
You'll see the number of gates you can
currently make in your Key Items.

A gate is easy to create! Go to the place
where you want to put it, then select the
travel medallion.
After that, you can travel to that spot
instantly by selecting it on the map,
just like you do with shrines.
If you delete a travel gate on the map,
you can then create a new one. So,
create them as often as you need to!
Talk_72:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Greeting_00>Hey, you! We have more work to do!
Your <clr:0000>Purah Pad<clr:ffff> is nowhere near its full
capability yet.
Talk_49:

instructions for this feature too. Hang

Talk_09:
<sp:3:0:2:0800><snd:LaughS_00>You're curious about my travel medallion
feature, aren't you?<sp:5:0:0> Can't blame you.
I'm only the greatest inventor ever!
<sp:3:0:2:0701>The <clr:0000>travel medallion<clr:ffff> feature is a
wonderful addition that lets you <clr:0000>travel
instantly<clr:ffff> to any spot you choose.
<clr:0000><sp:3:0:2:0c01><clr:ffff>But I left my <clr:0000>travel medallion prototype<clr:ffff>
back at the <clr:0000>Akkala Ancient Tech Lab<clr:ffff>.

<sp:3:0:2:0700>That's why I need you to go there and
fetch it for me!<sp:0:4:0>Word is that some <clr:0000>dangerous trespassers<clr:ffff>
have made themselves at home at that
tech lab.
So...<sp:5:0:0>you're the only one who can get it
for me. I've put the location on the
<clr:0000>map<clr:ffff> in your Purah Pad.
It's quite a long way, but if you keep
checking that map, you'll be able to
make your way right there.
Talk_32:

Talk_65:
<sp:3:0:2:0800><snd:Happy_00>The Purah Pad will be even better after
I add some extra features.<sp:0:4:0>Those include the most essential one,
the <clr:0000>travel medallion <clr:ffff>feature that lets you
set up gates for instant travel anywhere.
There's also <clr:0000>hero's path mode<clr:ffff>. It shows
where you've traveled. Finally, <clr:0000>sensor +<clr:ffff>,
which helps you find more than shrines.
<clr:0000><sp:3:0:2:0000><clr:ffff>Your Purah Pad will be perfect once
I've installed all of those!
Talk_25:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><clr:0000><snd:TalkPositive_00><clr:ffff>The <clr:0000>travel medallion<clr:ffff> feature is quite

a gate you've established elsewhere.
<sp:3:0:2:0c01>But we're going to have a little bit of
an extra challenge with all this...

<sp:3:0:2:0000>Come now, give me your Purah Pad for
a moment.
Talk_66:
<sp:3:0:2:0c01>It's hard to get data on monsters without
putting yourself at risk. You'll need a
careful approach, or a quiet one.
<sp:3:0:2:0700>Though...you could grab their attention
any old way you want and snap a picture
on the fly. Then you'll have your data.
